You can now buy the first wave of 2.0 ships. I'd not recommend buying loads of 1.0 then converting it as such isn't getting replaced so you'll be paying for conversion stuff you can't use. Also 2.0 models are of better quality than 1.0 so slowly building up on just 2.0 would be better imo (that's what I'd do if starting now). In 2.0 you also get quick build cards with a lookout and set upgrades that use a notional threat level rather than point based squad building. Play using these first to get an idea about what upgrades suit your play style. Once you've got a real handle in the hand mechanics give full squad building a go but playing the lists will teach you far more than planning. Mixing factions isn't permissible even in casual play. The xwing wiki is really useful for info, rules clarifications, build ideas... The people on their are really helpful http://xwing-miniatures-second-edition.wikia.com/wiki/X-Wing_Miniatures:_Second_Edition_Wiki

The Ward XVI patch is actually a larger circle patch (fucking circles, worst shape possible) so I tried cutting out just the band name and was quite happy with the result so can see me doing that for a few more before I'm resigned to this one being full. Maybe I'll never think it's full and just keep layering up.

Thanks man, I love it when I can get bits to fit really well together, most recent one I took great pleasure in is the Avatar lion's claw over the throat of the snake in Whitesnake like he's caught it. It's all in the minor details.

Wash the jacket before you start so the dye won't run in the rain. Don't be afraid to move stuff around (I've got patches in the their third or fourth position). Take the time to keep pockets working as they're useful as fuck. Steal ideas from other kuttes you see, use this sub, Tshirt Slayer, ones you see in the wild for inspiration. Don't buy knock-offs from Korea/China on eBay, they always look shit. Do whatever you like with it, mix up genres, styles, colours and enjoy the fuck out of making and wearing the thing #128077;
I've got one frozen in the Registry on the first icon with the books. Nothing to place, nothing to prestige, but the red dot just sits there taunting me.

Hobgoblin bottle top = a thumbs up from me #128077;
Saw one in a similar vein at Bloodstock last year. Was covered in sticky labels with hand-written band names on, shook the dudes hands there and then #128077;
Not seen that Helloween patch before, niiiiiice.

I wouldn't stash one there then jump in a mosh pit but if I'm staying out of the action I figured it'd be a useful way of keeping my hands free for drinking and whatnot. It's Bloodstock soon so can test it out then.
Well Hobgoblin is the best beer in the world #128540; I'm not a beer snob though, if you're enjoying what you're drinking who cares?

Hobgoblin is one of the first beers I discovered when I found that beer could actually taste good, beforehand I'd lived in a world of lagers that were drank purely to get drunk, and I still love the drink today. Though Wychwood has become my favourite brewery (Hobgoblin IPA is lush, big fan of Imperial Red and Goliath) they do some beers I really don't like, Dr Thirsty especially.

There's the fairground, strongman competition and loads of stalls to mooch around. Do you like rock music? If so bands like The Wildhearts, The Lazys, Blind River, Scorpions, Jailbirds could be worth a watch for ya. Sophie Sparham on the Jager stage is spoken word. There's films each evening in the Hobgoblin New Blood stage (Thursday - Wayne's World 2 amp; Bill amp; Ted's Bogus Journey, Friday - Conan, Saturday - From Dusk Til Dawn). If you've got access to the VIP bar there's other bands (including Slay Duggee who play children's TV themes in a metal style) on in there and stuff, check the Bloodstock VIP Facebook page for info. In the middle of the night there's the (unofficial) annual bin jousting contests near the Midgard campsite.
No snitches anywhere #128557;
Obviously as soon as I posted that I found 3 #129318; #8205; #9794; #65039;

WRITING.TITLE: Constant Fortress Error, Any Advice?
WRITING.TEXT: FIXED Recently I changed phones so have my old one (Huawei P10) to my daughter so she could play Wizards Unite. She's been using it a couple of weeks but she now can't enter any fortress chambers. She's done the fortress tutorial worst and completed Ruins 1 previously but now after selecting either Ruins 1 or 2 she gets an error stating there's no data or WiFi signal and is forced to restart the app. Weirdly when she goes into the fortress Harry still says the little flavor text explaining what fortresses are despite her already doing the tutorial. Phone worked fine for me since game launch (other than the few glitches that exist for everyone). Have tried both on Data and WiFi, multiple fortresses and uninstalling and reinstalling the app. All her settings in game match the same as on my phone. Any advice? Can't really play the game without fortresses. EDIT: Fixed - Contacting Support and going through on Chat fixed the problem (not filling a bug report). They said they needed to make a change to the account.

Cheers I'll give that a go. Filed a big report a few days ago but didn't seem to have done anything. I'll try getting hold of the chat people, they were useful in replacing lost runestones for me a while ago.
Yeah they're download, thanks.
This did the job, thank you u/Terraphile42!

We should be able to pick where we want red dots to appear. For me I do want: Potions (on map, not just in Suitcase), Assets, Registry levels/images, completed tasks, news. I don't want: anything to do with profile pictures, lessons, gifts.

Really can't see a change in learning currency coming because you'd still need green and red books of you started playing recently. Do new players just not get to progress the old lessons? Can't see higher level runestones becoming a thing but higher level fortresses are surely likely. Both though would mean earning CXP too quickly and that's already capped at level 150(ish? Something like that, I'm only ~80). Also wouldn't surprise me if the new lesson plans come out at the start of the new school year in September.
Then what about the 3 red books in the monthly rewards or the ones you get in events? Creating more currency just lowers your opportunities to get it.
I too seemed to see far less in the wild when on the bonus page than normal, got 'em in the end though by just waiting as there's still loads of time left in the event.
Remember it's running till Thursday this time so you've still got 2 days if you want to keep your DDs.
Iirc you need to be within 25m to get in the fortress to begin with but then only need to stay within 50m to keep entering chambers.

Disagree that being able to change would add extra strategy, all you'd do is pick Professor for a werewolf, switch to Auror for the death eater, back to Professor for the pixie etc... Plus if you can just pick to be whatever suits you get all the benefits without any drawbacks. Might as well scrap the professions altogether and just have one skill tree.
Cracking job, I love the crammed in style over neat symmetry. Where's that Power Trip patch from? Only seen white versions but loads better in colour.
Maxed Dark Arts months ago (I work in a DA area) and Oddities I maxed a couple of weeks ago. Lowest is Ministry of Magic which is level 46 atm.
Just hit the twat
It's not the only achievement that's impossible to currently complete, look at all the lesson related ones.
Of course it'll use the same currency. Bringing in new books would just make getting them even harder for existing players and getting the old ones harder for new players.

So do brilliant events stick to green books and get ignored by legacy players? Do they spilt events between both making new players take longer to catch up? Second lesson plans will obviously take a LOT more scrolls, because the balance is skewed. The only way I could see another book type working is if there's a scroll to book conversion mechanic.

I hope they all went back in the queue in the same order.

The first time I finished the game, back in the 90s, I hadn't ground levels, didn't have the best materia, hadn't bothered with chocobos. Had got to the bit where you go to the Northern Cave and I figured that'd probablybe the best place to try levelling up a bit before trying to fight Sephiroth but accidently went too far and fought and beat him. My level wasn't much higher than 50ish. Was many years later before I could beat Ruby and Emerald though and I've never played a specific save enough to master KOTR, would rather just play through again.

First, it's when you're going to the second reactor and have to jump off the train. If you run towards the screen a few times you end up at this dead end and you can spawn enemies to fight indefinitely.

Not working here, Motorola G7 Plus, with new app update.
If you can SEE the image, you've done it. The counter is irrelevant now.

I feel the opposite, completing the registry was impossible before. All those wand fragments based on a random from from Dark Chamber 4 or 5? Never going to happen. Now actually getting to gold and starring the image is possible. Plus there a reason to catch foundables that you've personally completed before thus a reason to help continue fighting the calamity. Placing am image didn't stop it so in terms of the "story" this makes much more sense.
When you've got all the images to show the star (so you've finished the fragment count) you can prestige the page. Any remaining fragments on starred images are then carried over to the next page.

If you turn in before, you'll get rewards depending on the page level and it goes back to 0/7 with a star. If you leave it and prestige the page the 7 carry over onto the next page (eg 7/14). Cashing in or waiting til you prestige is a personal choice but if you're on 7/7 and catch that foundable again you've "lost" the fragment in the way you always did before the update, it'll just start on 7/7.

Hard disagree with this. As someone who's maxed out their profession has over 600 runestones and does challenges to complete the registry, higher runestones means less chamber visits for that goal. I spend more time in l the lobby in Ruins than actually in the chamber so would like to minimise the number of times I'm forced to go through that process when fragment rewards are already annoyingly random.
Nothing is lost, you've converted the fragments into family XP.

You still get runestones when the family is maxed out, in fact you get better ones, that's the point of maxing it out. If I'd stopped collecting foundables once the family amp; and image were maxed I'd have similar nothing to do in the game.

I've got pages at all four levels and place every image as soon as I can. The fragments aren't lost they're converted in to Family XP (and now Ministry Manuals) and you can place them repeatedly, hell I placed McGonagall twice earlier today thanks to the Trace Charm). The only exception I make is community days that focus on one page. If I'm really close to being able to prestige the page then I'll hold off to try and bump up levels but for standard catches that feels futile.
